section.title: Fixed in this release
section.p: Unable to delete load balancers unless they are in active state. After creating load balancers, if they went into an ERROR or inactive state, the load balancers could not be deleted.
Error in nova_heartbeat_check An error in nova_heartbeat_check was resulting in Nova status information missing in the operations console.
Instance resizing fails Resizing an instance created from a bootable volume was failing with AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'backing'.

After Keystone password change, the operations console displays blank appliance screen After changing the Keystone password, the appliances screen of the operations console was would not be populated and notification errors were reported.
Cannot edit project in Horizon in Swift-only cloud The absence of Nova in a Swift-only cloud previously prevented the editing of a project using the Horizon dashboard.
Unabale to log into Horizon after running hlm-reconfigure.yml. Previously, a user might be unable to log into the Horizon dashboard after runningi the reconfigure playbook. This has been fixed.

Errors: Unable to set project quotas; Invalid service catalog When running in a multi-tenant environment, the Keystone policy file was previously not copied to the correct server, causing various project configuration issues. This has been fixed.
After turning off TLS for some endpoints in network_groups.yml, HTTPS was not changed to HTTP. This has been fixed.

body.section:
Issues in this release
Problems accessing Resource Usage from Admin > System tab in the Horizon dashboard Loading of the resource page may take a long time and give the impression that this tab is not working. In addition, when this page is loaded, on the Resource tab the Stats page may not load at all.
When using the Horizon UI, restore job fails in backup and restoreTo work around this issue, when creating a restore action, you must name the action the same as the backup action you are restoring.
If you are upgrading from to and encounter a failure running the pre-upgrade cinder-status check, follow the procedure here.

section.title: Upgrading to
section.p: Whether you are upgrading from or , the core procedure is the same and is documented in the upgrade procedure document. Note that you will be required to reboot your nodes.
